title: Two teenagers stabbed to death in double murder ‘at house party’
text:
Ambulances arrived in the street in Milton Keynes shortly after midnight, neighbours said (Picture: sbna_fairleys)

Two teenage boys aged 17 have died after a stabbing at a house party in a ‘quiet neighbourhood’, police said.

Neighbours this morning spoke of their horror at the double murder at around midnight last night in Archford Croft, in the Emerson Valley area of Milton Keynes.

One boy is understood to have died at the scene while another died a short time later in hospital.

Police said two men were also injured in the incident and have been left with serious injuries, not believed to be life threatening.

A neighbour, who did not want to be named, said: ‘Apparently there was some sort of party going on at the house and a group of young people arrived and got into the house. I don’t think the boys knew each other.

‘Soon after midnight loads of police cars and ambulances arrived in the road and there were blue lights everywhere.

Forensic examiners at the scene of the double murder today (Picture: sbna_fairleys)

‘I have been told that the boys who died were not related in any way and that the murders look a bit like gang violence.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘This is normally a nice quiet neighbourhood and hardly anything ever happens here.

‘I just can’t believe that two teenage boys have been viciously murdered in our street.’

Post-mortem examinations are due to take place at Milton Keynes Hospital today but police have confirmed that both boys had stab wounds.

Archford Croft was sealed off by police this morning as forensic experts combed the area for clues. A police guard was also placed on a house in the road and at the entrance to the road.

No arrests have been made, Thames Valley Police said in a statement this morning.

Police said two adult men were also injured in the incident (Picture: sbna_fairleys)

Head of Crime Detective Chief Superintendent Ian Hunter said: ‘Thames Valley Police is in the early stages of a double murder investigation after two teenage boys have tragically died in this shocking incident.

‘Our priorities at this time are to conduct a thorough investigation and to support those who have been affected. Officers are currently at the scene which has been cordoned off and members of the public are asked to avoid the area.

‘I would like to speak to anyone who has any information which could help with our enquiries or anyone who witnessed any suspicious activity in the area of Archford Croft at around the time of the incident around midnight.

‘Even if you think details may be insignificant, please come forward and speak to police.’

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
